note: This is a surprise!
He is causing a lot of trouble!
answer: What a lot of trouble he is causing!

note: They are wonderful actors!
She is a hard-working woman!
It is a tall building!
It's a terrible film!
You are a clever boy!
answer: What a clever boy you are!

note: She is a pretty girl!
He is a strange guy!

desc_EN: Write each of the fllowing sentences in a different way:
note: He paid the shopkeeper some money.
answer: He paid some money to the shopkeeper .

note: He handed me the prize.
answer: He handed  the prize to me.

note: The waiter brought a bottle of beer to the man.
answer: The waiter brought the man a bottle of beer.

note: He sold all his books to me.
answer: He sold me all his books.

note: The shop assistant found some curtain material for me.
answer: The shop assistant found me some curtain material.

note: He did me a big favour.
answer: He did a big favour for me.

note: She showed her husband her new hat.
answer: She showed her new hat to her husband.

note: She promised a reward to the finder.
answer: She promised the finder a reward.

note: He gave his son some advice.
answer: He gave some advice to his son .

note: His uncle left him some money.
answer: His uncle left some money to/for him .

note: He is teaching English to us.
I bought this bounch of flowers for you.
answer: I bought you this bounch of flowers .

note: Bring that book to me please.
He offered me a cigarette.
answer: He offered a cigarette to me.

note: Read me the first paragraph.
answer: Read the first paragraph to me.

note: I've ordered some soup for you.
I own him a lot money.
answer: I own a lot money to him.

note: Pass the mustard to your father.

I(took)(received)the letter with me.
He has(taken)(received) some flowers to her.
Why did you(received)(take) this book off the shelf?

desc_EN: Rewrite these sentences using +++spare+++ or to +++spare+++ in place of the words or phrases in italics.Make any other necessary changes.
desc_CH: 改写下面的句子，用 spare 的形容词形式或动词形式来代替句子中用斜体书写的单词或短语，并对句中的其他部分作必要的改动。
note: There is +++an extra+++ wheel in the back of the car.
answer: There is a +++spare+++ wheel in the back of the car.

note: I always go on excursions in my +++free+++ time.
answer: I always go on excursions in my +++spare+++ time.

note: ‘Have you any old clothes +++that you do not want+++?’he asked.
The guest slept in the room +++we do not use+++.
‘+++Do not kill+++ me!’begged the prisoner.

desc_EN: Rewrite these sentences using the correct from of the verb +++knock+++ in place of the words in italics.
desc_CH: 改写以下的句子，用含有 knock 的短语动词来代替以下句子中用斜体印出的词语。
note: The old lady hit the thief over the head with a candlestick and +++now he is unconscious+++.
At what time do you +++finish work+++ every day?
The shopkeeper +++reduced+++ the price of all his goods +++by 20%+++.

desc_EN: We can change the position of the words in italics in some of the sentences below.For instance,we can change the position of the word +++out+++ in this sebtence:He put +++out+++ the fire.But we cannot change the position of the word +++for+++ in this sentence:He is looking +++for+++ his pen.Where possible,change the position of the words in italics in the sentences below.
desc_CH: 在下面的有些句子中我们可以调换用斜体印出的词的位置。比如说：在“He put +++out+++ the fire.”这句话中，我们可以变动out的位（He put the fire +++put+++.)。但是，在“He is looking +++for his pen.”中，我们却不能变动for的位置，如有可能，调换下列句子中用斜体印出词的位置。
note: He give +++away+++ all his books.
She woke +++up+++ the children early this moring.
answer: She woke the children +++up+++  early this moring.

note: He is looking +++for+++ his umbrella.
They cut +++off+++ the king's head.
Put +++on+++ your hat and coat.
Give it +++back+++ to your brother.
Help me to lift +++up+++ this table.
answer: Help me to lift this table +++up+++.

note: Take +++off+++ your shoes and put +++on+++ you slippers.
answer: Take your shoes +++off+++ and put +++on+++ you slippers.

note: He is looking +++at+++ the picture.
Send her +++away+++ or she will cause trouble.
They have pulled +++down+++ the old building.
answer: They have pulled  the old building +++down+++.

note: Make +++up+++your mind.
He asked +++for+++ perission to leave.
She thew +++away+++ all those old newspapers.
answer: She threw all those old newspapers +++away+++.

I heared a noise znd went downstaires.I found that everything (were)(was) in order.

desc_EN: Write negative answers to these questions in two different ways.
desc_CH: 用两种不同的方式来对以下疑问句做出否定的回答。
note: Have you any money?
Did you go anywhere in the holidays?
answer: No,I didn't go anywhere/went nowhere in the holidays.

note: Did you buy anything this morning?
answer: No,I didn't buy any thing/bought nothing this morning.

note: Was there anybody present when the accident happened?
answer: No,there wasn't anybody/was nobody present when the accident happened.

answer: He has no hobbies.He goes nowhere.He sees nobody.He is interested in nothing----except food.

She showed me +++one of John's pictures+++.
answer: She showed me +++a picture of Jone's+++.

note: It was +++one of her ideas+++.
/+++One of your letters+++ was found on my desk.
answer: A +++letter of yours+++ was found on my desk.

note: /+++Some of their friends+++ came to see me.
answer: +++Some friends of theirs+++ came to see me.

desc_EN: Put the words in parentheses in their correct order.
desc_CH: 将括号内的词按正确的语序安排好。

answer: He wants +++his wife to wear this dress+++.

I cannot allow (the room,him,to enter).
answer: I cannot allow +++him to enter the room+++.

desc_EN: Replace the words in italics by the correct phrase with +++be+++ or +++set+++.
desc_CH: 用短语动词be或set来代替下列句子中斜体印出的部分。
note: He +++has not yet returned.+++ He will +++return in ten minutes+++.
answer: He +++is not back yet+++.He +++will be back+++ in ten minutes.

note: A new play is +++being performed+++ at the Globe Theatre.
answer: A new play is +++on+++ at Globe Theatre.

note: When the concert +++ended+++,we went home.
answer: When the concert +++was over+++.We went home.

note: They will +++leave+++ very early tomorrow morning.
answer: They will +++set out/off+++ very early tomorrow morning.(Here +++be off+++ is also possible.)

note: You can't take the exam yet.You are not +++capable of+++ it.
answer: You can't take the exam yet.You are not +++up to it+++.

note: He will be +++absent+++ from home for two months.
answer: He will be +++away+++ from home for two months.

note: She swam across the English Channel and +++created+++ a new world record.
answer: She swam across the English Channel and +++set up+++ a new world record.

desc_EN: What a day!(SD2)
desc_CH:
感叹句（参见第 2 课难点）
英语中的感叹句通常用 What 来引导，用来表示惊奇、愤怒、赞赏、喜悦等情感，结构通常为：What + 形容词 + 名词 + 主语 + 谓语动词 （包括连系动词）。

note: It is a tall building!

desc_EN: Write this piece of conversation again using speech marks:
note: Look!she said,isn't that man drunk?I think we should cross the road,answered her husband.It's too late now,she replied.Eh,you two.Look where you're going,called the drunk.Can't you walk in a straight line?
answer:
‘Look!’she said,‘isn't that man drunk?’
‘I think we should cross the road,’answered her husband.
‘It's too late now,’she replied.
‘Eh,you two.Look where you're going,’called the drunk.‘Can't you walk in a straight line?’

desc_EN: Write this piece of conversation again using speech marks.Refer to the dialogue in the exercise above when you have finished:
desc_CH: 为下面的对话加上引号，完成练习后对照关键句型的练习部分：
note: I am inquiring about a certain patient,Mr.Gilbert said.Was Mr.Gilbert's operation successful?he asked.Yes,it was ,the doctor told him.When will Mr.Gilbert be allowed to go home?he asked.He will have to stay in hospital for another two weeks,the doctor told him.Are you a relative of the patient?Dr.Millington asked the caller.No,the patient answered,I am Mr.John Gilbert.
answer: ‘I am inquiring about a certain patient,’Mr.Gilbert said.‘Was Mr.Gilbert's operation successful?’he asked.‘Yes,it was ,’the doctor told him.‘When will Mr.Gilbert be allowed to go home?’he asked.‘He will have to stay in hospital for another two weeks,’the doctor told him.‘Are you a relative of the patient?’Dr.Millington asked the caller.‘No,’the patient answered,‘I am Mr.John Gilbert.’

desc_EN: Get(第74课a);keep(第78课);take(第79课);tun(第88课);make(第91课).

note: He lies would not take ____ anybody but a fool.
The explorers returned because they had run ____ food.

It took him a long time to get ____ his illness.

During the storm,the ship made ____ the nearest harbour.
Has this car been run ____ yet?
The bird accidentally flew into the room and could't get ____ .
He spoke so quickly,I didn't have time to take ____ what he said.
Though we all run ____ the thief,we could not catch him.

If you happen ____.

note: say/nothing/her.
explain/the position/me

note: propose/idea/us.
answer: They proposed the idea to us.

desc_EN: Write these sentenses again beginning each one with the words in italics:
note: He has +++not only+++ made this mistake before but he will make it again.
answer: Not only has he made this mistake before but he will make it again.

note: I realized what was happening +++only then+++.
answer: Only then did I realize what was happening.

note: I will +++never+++ trust him again.
answer: Never will I trust him again.

note: You +++seldom+++ find traffic wardens who are kind and helpful.
answer: Seldom do you find traffic wardens who are kind and helpful.

desc_EN: Write this paragraph again using full stops and capital letters where necessary:
note: because tim tones cannot speak french or german he never enjoys travelling abroad last march,however,he went to denmark and stayed in copenhagen he said he spent most of his time at the tivoli which is one of the biggest funfairs in the world at the tivoli you can enjoy yourself very much even if you don't speak danish.
answer: Because Tim Jones cannot speak French or German,he never enjoys travelling abroad.Last March,however,he went to Denmark and stayed in Copenhagen.He said he spent most of his time at the Tivoli,which is one of the biggest funfairs in the world.At the Tivoli,you can enjoy yourself very much,even if you don't speak Danish.

desc_EN: Rewrite the following sentences using had better in place of it would be advisable.
note: It would be advisable for us to have lunch.
It would be advisable for her to renew her passport.
It would not be advisable for you to ask so many questions.
answer: You'd better not ask so many questions.

note: It would not be advisable for us to stay any longer.
answer: We’d better not stay any longer.

note: It would be advisable for the children to get an early night.
answer: The children had better get an early night.

note: It would be advisable for me to consult my solicitor.

desc_EN: Add -s or -ies to the following words. Make any other necessary changes:
note: lady,supply,valley,qualify,story,day,say,reply,marry,way,chimney,hurry,stay,enjoy,buy,body,bury,fry.

desc_EN: Note how commas are used in the following sentences:
note: Before going home I went to the grocer’s. Bill Smith the man who always serves me was very busy. This however did not worry me. On the contrary it gave me the opportunity to look round for several things I wanted. By the time my turn came I had already filled a basket with packets of biscuits cans of fruit bars of soap and two large bags of flour.
answer: Before going home, I went to the grocer’s. Bill Smith, the man who always serves me, was very busy. This, however, did not worry me. On the contrary, it gave me the opportunity to look round for several things I wanted. By the time my turn came, I had already filled a basket with packets of biscuits, cans of fruit, bars of soap and two large bags of flour.
